meanings.definition: A small, natural underground chamber typically having an opening in a hillside or cliff.
meanings.sent1: The brave explorer found a hidden cavel in the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The bats flew out of the dark cavel as the sun set.
meanings.sent3: The bear thought the cavel was a cozy spot for hibernation.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a mysterious cavel, full of undiscovered secrets.
meanings.sent5: The cavel's entrance was covered in lush green vines, like a secret garden.

meanings.definition: To explore caves as a sport.
meanings.sent1: We decided to cavel in the nearby mountains for our adventure.
meanings.sent2: Many tourists come to cavel in this region every summer.
meanings.sent3: He loved to cavel so much that he became a professional guide.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity led her to cavel through the ancient tunnels.
meanings.sent5: The group planned to cavel through the underground maze together.

meanings.definition: To place or store in a cave.
meanings.sent1: The villagers would cavel their food supplies to keep them cool.
meanings.sent2: The treasure hunters decided to cavel the ancient artifacts for safekeeping.
meanings.sent3: She would cavel her most precious belongings in the hidden cavern.
meanings.sent4: The old books were carefully caveled in the underground library.
meanings.sent5: The explorers had to cavel their equipment before entering the dark cave.
